title: Omni Network Signs $600M Restaking Deal With Ether.Fi to Enhance Security
description: Liquid restaking protocol Ether.Fi will commit $600 million worth of ether {{ETH}} in a delegation deal to secure the Omni Network.

title: USDR Issuer Tangible Plans to Redeem Itself as a Layer-2 for Real-World Assets
description: First came the literal redemption for failed stablecoin USDR. Now comes the metaphorical redemption as Tangible changes its name to re.al.

title: Here’s what happened in crypto today
description:
Need to know what happened in crypto today? Here is the latest news on daily trends and events impacting Bitcoin price, blockchain, DeFi, NFTs, Web3 and crypto regulation.

Bitcoin (BTC) has made a new all-time high against the euro at 60,000 euros per coin and the Mexican peso is the next target to beat. Coinbase has introduced embedded, smart contracts for developers — a move it says will address devs' pain points when building Web3 applications. Meanwhile, crypto traders in Nigeria are up in arms after Binance removed the Nigerian naira from its peer-to-peer (P2P) service.

Bitcoin (BTC) has passed a new all-time high against the euro as the cryptocurrency’s price reached a new multi-year high of $65,000.

According to data from TradingView, Bitcoin touched 60,393 euros at 8:30 am UTC, surging about 5% from its intraday low of 57,521 EUR. At the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at 59,981 euros, up around 56% year-to-date.

Read more

title: What determines the Bitcoin price?
description:
The market forces of supply and demand determine Bitcoin’s price, which is volatile due to the uncertainty regarding BTC’s future value.

Market forces called supply and demand influence Bitcoin’s price. The price typically decreases when there are more sellers or vice versa.

Bitcoin (BTC) is a cryptocurrency that is not issued by any government or legal body, in contrast to fiat currencies, such as the United States dollar, the British pound, the euro and the Japanese yen. To create, store and move BTC, a dispersed network of users and cryptographic protocols are required.

Read more

title: AgileGTM announces first $10 million B2B blockchain accelerator fund
description:

title: Coinbase legal chief downplays court ruling on crypto as securities in insider trading case
description:
Paul Grewal, the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase, downplayed the impact of a recent court ruling that classified certain digital assets on secondary markets trading platforms as securities in a recent social media post.
